meanings.definition: A small, shallow drinking cup with two handles, typically made of wood and used in Scotland.
meanings.sent1: During the celebration, they passed around the quaich filled with warm tea.
meanings.sent2: The quaich was passed down through generations as a family heirloom.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they pretended the quaich was a magical potion, taking turns sipping from it.
meanings.sent4: The quaich, like a loyal friend, held the memories of many toasts shared around it.
meanings.sent5: The intricate carvings on the quaich made it a unique and cherished piece.

meanings.sent1: He eagerly quaiched the warm cider at the festival.
meanings.sent2: In Scotland, it is customary to quaich from a shared cup during special occasions.
meanings.sent3: She playfully challenged her friend to a race of who could quaich their drink faster.
meanings.sent4: The team quaiched victory after a hard-fought match.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they gathered around to quaich in the beauty of the moment.
